intro: Stroganowia puberula, commonly known as the pubescent stroganowia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Acanthaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its hairy, pubescent leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
